lines.text: Motion along a circular path at constant speed
Acceleration is solely due to change in direction

secText:
Essential Question:
How can we determine the rotational period and centripetal acceleration of an object in circular motion?

Enduring Understandings:
1. [OBJ:expsec_h556:Uniform circular motion] is motion along a circular path at a constant speed.
2. The rotational [OBJ:expsec_5180:period] for the orbit of an object can be calculated by dividing 2Ï€r, by the constant speed that the object is moving.
3. The [OBJ:expsec_h557:centripetal acceleration] of an object can be calculated by dividing the speed of an object moving in circular motion squared, by the radius of the circle.
